Description: Fragments from a jug: with pointed (?) base in opaque dark-blue glass reassembled from fragments; about half of the body, much of the neck and rim, and the whole of the base are missing. The flat rim is bordered with prefabricated cording in opaque yellow and dark blue. The neck has irregular chevrons in opaque white and yellow glass. On the body are clustered festoon and swirl patterns in opaque white and yellow bordered at top and bottom by a single yellow thread. Below the shoulder is one vertical handle in the body material, overlaid with white and yellow threads. The root of another handle remains. Low gloss.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Illahun, Kahun and Gurob’ 1889-1890 (London 1891), 17, the fragments were recovered 'from a pit with ashes'; B. Nolte, ‘Die Glasgefässe in Alten Ägypten (Berlin 1968), 71 (under no. 90-11-9, 2).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1891 / Illahun, Kahun and Gurob (p. 17, pl. XVII)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
